meta.name: EFL Individual Client Profile - High School Basketball Off-Season
meta.owner: Austin Lawrence, Director of Performance Systems
meta.codexReference: §4.4 Population Architecture; Sport Demands Grid v2.0; Load Standards v2.2.0; EFL_Periodization_FV_Schema_v2_1; EFL_Governance_v4_1; EFL_Coach_AI_Playbook_v0_5_0; MDP_COURT_VERTICAL v1.4
changes_from_v2_3: Added fv_bias_profile block with default VELOCITY_BIASED, legal biases per season/population, assessment protocol
Added fv_bias population/season override rules aligned to Governance v4.1 Gate 2
Updated population_ceilings.rationale to reference Load Standards v2.2.0
Added fv_band_targets showing zone distribution targets by bias profile (VELOCITY_BIASED 65% velocity zones, BALANCED 50/50)
Added fv_zone_emphasis and supported_bias_profiles to elastic and deceleration blocks
Added gate7_fv_bias_validation sub-section explaining EPA Gate 7 algorithm, variance thresholds, and coach actions
Updated epa_integration_notes.specialization_block_activation with Gate 7 behavior and bias legality validation
Updated codexReference to include Load Standards v2.2.0, Periodization v2.1, Governance v4.1, Playbook v0.5.0
Aligned all load ceiling language and bias rules to v2.2.0 and Governance v4.1 standards

icp_definition.description: High school basketball athlete (ages 14-18, grades 9-12) in off-season development phase. Focus on vertical jump, reactive strength, deceleration mechanics, and multi-directional speed. Eligible for specialization blocks with proper prerequisites. F-V bias aware with legal bias determination per population/season.

target_population.training_age_minimum: 1 year (6 months for baseline programming, 1 year for specialization blocks)

fv_bias_profile.description: Force-Velocity bias rules for HS Basketball Off-Season per Load Standards v2.2.0 and Governance v4.1
fv_bias_profile.rationale_for_default: Youth 13-17 basketball emphasizes elastic power (vertical jump, reactive strength) and COD speed. VELOCITY_BIASED bias targets Z3/Z4/Z7/Z8 zones naturally suited to basketball demands. See Periodization Schema v2.1 Section 3F for zone→bias alignment.
fv_bias_profile.assessment_protocol: CMJ height + RSI (30cm drop), Squat 1RM vs BW ratio per Load Standards v2.2.0 Section 4.1 Diagnostics. Assessment date required in EPA input.

bias_override_rules.rule_1: If IN_SEASON or POST_SEASON detected, EPA automatically overrides to BALANCED per Governance v4.1 Gate 2, regardless of athlete history
bias_override_rules.rule_2: Youth 16 & under: BALANCED only (all seasons) per Load Standards v2.2.0 Table 5.2 Population Rules
bias_override_rules.rule_3: Youth 17 advanced: VELOCITY_BIASED/FORCE_BIASED allowed OFF/PRE seasons only; BALANCED forced IN/POST per Governance v4.1 Gate 1

fv_bias_profile.note: This ICP applies exclusively to OFF_SEASON athletes. In-season basketball athletes use separate ICP_HS_BASKETBALL_INSEASON with bias forced BALANCED per Governance v4.1 Gate 2.

load_standard_profile.description: Youth 13-17 basketball athlete load ceilings and targets, aligned to Load Standards v2.2.0

population_ceilings.rationale: Load Standards v2.2.0 Youth 13-17 hard ceilings enforced across ALL programming. See Load Standards v2.2.0 Table 3.2 (Youth 13-17 Hard Caps). Ceilings apply regardless of F-V bias selection.

baseline_programming_targets.description: Default MDP_COURT_VERTICAL programming when NOT in specialization block
baseline_programming_targets.note: Baseline programming operates at 75-83% of population ceilings, leaving headroom for specialization blocks

fv_band_targets.description: Weekly zone distribution targets aligned to FV Periodization Schema v2.1 Section 2B and Gate 7 compliance
fv_band_targets.applies_to: Baseline MDP programming (FULLSESSION); specialization blocks override with block-specific zones

velocity_biased_distribution.rationale: VELOCITY_BIASED profile targets 65-70% volume in velocity/elastic/speed zones (Z3/Z4/Z7/Z8) per Periodization Schema v2.1 Section 3F

balanced_distribution.rationale: BALANCED profile targets 50/50 distribution across velocity and strength zones per Periodization Schema v2.1 Section 3F

fv_band_targets.zone_reference: See EFL_Periodization_FV_Schema_v2_1.md Section 2 for zone definitions and Section 2B for band mapping
fv_band_targets.gate7_note: Weekly zone distribution validated by EPA v2.2.1 Gate 7 against declared fv_bias_profile. Variance ≤10% GREEN, 11-20% YELLOW, >20% QUARANTINED_REVIEW per EPA v2.2.1 Section 6 Step 5

elastic_block.fv_note: Elastic block emphasizes Z3 (Speed-Strength), Z4 (Elastic/Reactive), and Z8 (COD recovery) per Periodization Schema v2.1. Aligns naturally with VELOCITY_BIASED and BALANCED profiles. E3 (reactive shock) allowed up to 40% per Load Standards v2.2.0 Tier 3 youth cap. Expected EPA Gate 7 status: GREEN for VELOCITY_BIASED athletes.
elastic_block.note: Operates at 83% of ceiling - higher than baseline but with safety margin

deceleration_block.fv_note: Deceleration block emphasizes Z2 (Strength-Speed loaded jumps), Z5 (Strength-Endurance eccentric work), and Z8 (COD braking) per Periodization Schema v2.1. Best supported by BALANCED bias for control/stability emphasis. E3 minimized (20-30% max) to favor control/stability over shock. Expected EPA Gate 7 status: GREEN for BALANCED athletes, YELLOW if VELOCITY_BIASED (bias mismatch).
deceleration_block.note: Lower contact volume than elastic, more eccentric emphasis, sprint work integrated

specialization_block_eligibility.description: Rules for when HS basketball athletes can access specialization blocks

general_eligibility_requirements.fv_bias_legality_requirement: Bias must be legal for population/season per fv_bias_profile rules above
general_eligibility_requirements.rationale: Youth 13-17 tissue maturation and training age limit specialization frequency to prevent overuse. F-V bias must align with population maturity and season per Load Standards v2.2.0 and Governance v4.1.

plyometric_exposure_weeks.description: Athlete must have completed minimum 8 weeks of progressive plyometric training (E0→E1→E2)
plyometric_exposure_weeks.rationale: Elastic block operates at E1-E3 with 40% Tier 3 - requires established plyo base

landing_quality_baseline.assessment_method: Coach-scored landing quality rubric (depth, control, sound, alignment)
landing_quality_baseline.rationale: Poor landing mechanics + high plyo volume = injury risk

previous_vertical_jump_training.description: Athlete has previous exposure to bilateral/unilateral jumps across E0-E2
previous_vertical_jump_training.rationale: Block emphasizes E2-E3 reactive work - needs foundation

tissue_health_status.knee_status: No pain, no history of patellar tendinopathy active phase
tissue_health_status.ankle_status: No sprain within 8 weeks, adequate dorsiflexion (≥35°)
tissue_health_status.achilles_status: No tendon pain, no history of Achilles tendinopathy
tissue_health_status.rationale: Elastic block = high tendon load, tissue must be healthy

entry_gates_summary.fv_bias_legality: BALANCED or VELOCITY_BIASED (HARD_GATE per Governance v4.1 Gate 1)

guards.rationale: Guards benefit significantly from vertical elastic power for finishing at rim, rebounding from perimeter
guards.emphasis_adjustment: Week 2 can increase lateral bounds for defensive slides

wings.rationale: Wings need vertical power for rebounding, cutting, finishing through contact

posts.rationale: Posts need vertical power for rebounding and rim protection, but also need strength base
posts.emphasis_adjustment: Consider strength block first if squat <1.5x BW, then elastic block
posts.caution: Higher body mass = higher landing forces, monitor knee/ankle closely

secondary_indicators: Good landing mechanics but low elastic output

eccentric_exposure_weeks.description: Athlete must have completed minimum 4 weeks of tempo eccentric work (3/0/1 or slower)
eccentric_exposure_weeks.rationale: Decel block emphasizes eccentric control - requires tissue adaptation to eccentric loads

single_leg_squat_quality.assessment_method: FMS-style single-leg squat scoring (depth, control, alignment, stability)
single_leg_squat_quality.rationale: Unilateral control prerequisite for deceleration safety

bilateral_squat_competency.description: Athlete can perform bodyweight squat to parallel with control for 10+ reps
bilateral_squat_competency.rationale: Foundational strength required before intensive deceleration work

tissue_health_status.knee_status: No active injury, no recent MCL/ACL issues, patellar tendon healthy
tissue_health_status.ankle_status: No sprain within 4 weeks, adequate dorsiflexion (≥35°), no chronic instability without support
tissue_health_status.rationale: Decel block = high braking forces, tissue must tolerate eccentric loads

performance_targets.505_agility_improvement: ≥3% improvement OR <10% L vs R asymmetry

guards.rationale: Guards need elite COD for defensive pressure, closeouts, transition defense. High injury risk position (ACL) - prevention focus.
guards.emphasis_adjustment: Week 3 can emphasize 90° cuts and defensive-specific patterns (defensive slides to jump stop)
guards.injury_prevention_note: Guards highest ACL injury rate - decel block is injury prevention priority

wings.rationale: Wings need COD for closeouts, help-side defense, cutting. Moderate injury risk.
wings.emphasis_adjustment: Standard block structure optimal, focus on multi-directional control

posts.rationale: Posts need deceleration for rebounding positioning and post defense, but less COD frequency than perimeter players
posts.emphasis_adjustment: Week 1-2 can extend (bilateral braking emphasis), Week 3 can reduce volume
posts.caution: Higher body mass = higher braking forces, extra attention to knee alignment

typical_athlete_profile.primary_limiter: COD speed below position average OR previous knee injury
secondary_indicators: Knee valgus present on cuts (corrective needed)
Previous ACL or meniscus injury (prevention focus)
Athlete reports 'feeling out of control on cuts'
typical_athlete_profile.best_timing: Weeks 1-4 OR 7-10 of off-season (flexible), can extend into prep season

block_contraindications.description: When NOT to use specialization blocks for HS basketball athletes

absolute_contraindications.condition: Athlete already completed one specialization block this training year
absolute_contraindications.rationale: Youth 13-17 population limit is ONE block per year - tissue maturation constraint
Competition load + block volume = exceeds weekly ceilings per Load Standards v2.2.0
Insufficient training base for specialization intensity
Specialization requires full recovery capacity - compromised readiness = injury risk

absolute_contraindications.applies_to: Elastic block: landing quality, Decel block: single-leg squat
absolute_contraindications.rationale: Poor movement quality + high volume = technique breakdown and injury
Governance v4.1 Gate 1 prohibits certain biases per population/season. EPA will REJECT if bias illegal.

relative_contraindications.recommendation: Use baseline MDP programming for general development
relative_contraindications.rationale: Specialization is for targeted adaptation - generalists need broad base first

relative_contraindications.recommendation: Return to baseline programming, rebuild base before block
Conservative approach - corrective work before specialization
relative_contraindications.rationale: Tissue quality may not tolerate specialization volume

relative_contraindications.condition: Body mass significantly above position average (>95th percentile)
relative_contraindications.recommendation: Extra monitoring, may need volume reduction 10-15%
relative_contraindications.rationale: Higher mass = higher landing/braking forces - increased tissue stress

use_baseline_instead_if: Athlete needs broad athletic development (not specialist yet)
Insufficient prerequisites met (training age, exposure, movement quality)
Post-injury returning to training (need gradual rebuild)
First off-season with structured training (build base first)

block_sequencing_for_youth_13_17.description: How to choose which block to use when limited to ONE per training year

step_1.question: Does athlete have previous knee injury (ACL, meniscus) OR knee valgus present?

step_2.question: Is athlete's position guard (PG, SG, combo guard)?
step_2.if_yes: LEAN TOWARD DECELERATION BLOCK (guards highest ACL risk + COD critical)

step_3.question: What is the PRIMARY performance limiter?

step_4.question: Which adaptation would have greatest sport impact?
step_4.if_still_unclear: Use baseline programming this year, reassess next off-season

year_1_offseason.recommendation: Choose ONE block based on primary limiter
year_1_offseason.example: Freshman year: Deceleration block (build movement quality + injury prevention)

year_2_offseason.recommendation: Choose OTHER block OR repeat same block if limiter persists
year_2_offseason.example: Sophomore year: Elastic block (now that movement quality established)

year_3_offseason.recommendation: Alternate or focus on persistent limiter
year_3_offseason.example: Junior year: Return to deceleration (ACL prevention priority for in-season)

year_4_offseason.example: Senior year: Elastic block (maximize vertical for recruitment/performance)

multi_year_planning.note: This is ONE possible progression - actual path depends on individual athlete development, injury history, position demands

gate7_fv_bias_validation.description: How EPA v2.2.1 validates block programming against F-V bias per EPA Section 6 Gate 7
gate7_fv_bias_validation.applies_when: Any session generated for this athlete is run through EPA v2.2.1
gate7_fv_bias_validation.validation_algorithm: EPA sums zone volumes per session, maps to bands per Periodization Schema v2.1 Section 2B, compares actual to bias target (70% for FORCE/VELOCITY_BIASED, 50/50 for BALANCED)

variance_thresholds.green_threshold: ≤10% variance from bias target → Program approved, meets F-V bias target
variance_thresholds.yellow_threshold: 11-20% variance → Program outputs but flagged for coach review; functional but off-target
variance_thresholds.red_threshold: >20% variance → QUARANTINED_REVIEW, coach must revise zone selection

gate7_fv_bias_validation.elastic_block_gate7_note: Elastic block zones (Z3, Z4, Z8) naturally support VELOCITY_BIASED and BALANCED. Expected weekly distribution should align with declared bias. If athlete is VELOCITY_BIASED, elastic block programs typically GREEN Gate 7. If BALANCED, may run YELLOW but still acceptable.
gate7_fv_bias_validation.decel_block_gate7_note: Decel block zones (Z2, Z5, Z8) emphasize strength/stability, best for BALANCED bias. If athlete is BALANCED, decel programs typically GREEN Gate 7. If athlete is VELOCITY_BIASED and assigned decel block, weekly programs may run YELLOW Gate 7 (bias mismatch) unless coach adjusts zone mix (add more Z3/Z4).
gate7_fv_bias_validation.coach_action_if_red: If EPA returns RED Gate 7 (variance >20%), coach must either: (a) revise zone selection to match athlete bias, or (b) reassess if block choice aligns with athlete profile and F-V bias

performance_assessment_battery.description: Testing protocols for block entry validation and exit criteria verification

required_for_all_blocks.method: Visual assessment on single-leg squat, single-leg landing, lateral movement
Athlete self-report + coach observation + manual palpation if indicated
required_for_all_blocks.pass_threshold: No active lower limb pain or injury

required_for_all_blocks.method: CMJ height + RSI (30cm drop), Squat 1RM vs BW per Load Standards v2.2.0 Diagnostics
required_for_all_blocks.pass_threshold: Assessment date recorded, bias determined and documented
required_for_all_blocks.purpose: Provide EPA v2.2.1 with fv_bias, fv_bias_assessment_date, fv_bias_rationale

elastic_block_specific.method: Bilateral landing from 30cm box, scored on depth, control, sound, alignment (0-10 scale)
3 max effort jumps, best height recorded
Drop jump from 30cm, calculate RSI = jump height / ground contact time
10 continuous max jumps, calculate decrement from first to last

deceleration_block_specific.method: FMS-style scoring (depth, control, alignment, stability, 0-10 scale)
15m sprint, 180° turn, 5m return, time both directions
deceleration_block_specific.purpose: Baseline for ≥3% improvement OR <10% asymmetry target

deceleration_block_specific.method: Max distance hop on each leg, compare L vs R
Measure knee-to-wall distance, convert to degrees
deceleration_block_specific.purpose: ≥35° required for proper deceleration shin angle

tests_required: Tissue health query (no knee pain, no tendon irritation)
elastic_block.success_definition: All performance + movement quality + tissue health criteria passed

tests_required: Single-leg hop asymmetry (<10% L vs R)
deceleration_block.success_definition: All COD speed + movement quality + tissue health criteria passed

tissue_health_monitoring.description: What to monitor throughout blocks to ensure athlete safety

pre_session: Subjective pain/soreness query (any knee, ankle, hip, achilles discomfort?)
Landing quality spot-check (3 reps, visual assessment)
during_session: Knee alignment on every landing (valgus = immediate stop)
Landing sound quality (loud thuds = technique breakdown)
Braking distance on deceleration drills (lengthening = fatigue/technique issue)
post_session: Pain query (any knee, ankle, tendon pain during or after?)
Joint stability check (ankle single-leg balance, knee stability)
Athlete subjective report (how did it feel?)

assessments: Readiness trend analysis (≥3 GREEN days required per week)
Movement quality re-check (landing or single-leg squat)
Performance tracking (jump height or COD time)
Body composition (if available - excessive weight loss = underrecovery)
red_flags: Readiness YELLOW/RED ≥3 days in one week
Knee valgus emerging (was absent, now present)
Athlete reporting excessive fatigue or lack of motivation
action_if_red_flag: May need to terminate block and return to baseline

annual_periodization_template.description: Sample 16-week off-season structure showing block placement, aligned to F-V bias and EPA requirements

scenario_1_elastic_emphasis.athlete_profile: Wing player, vertical jump limiter, VELOCITY_BIASED bias, no injury history

structure.focus: Recovery + re-entry to baseline MDP (Zone 8 primary)
General athletic development, maintain elastic gains (Z3/Z4/Z7/Z8 emphasis per baseline distribution)
structure.expected_gate7: GREEN (baseline targets 65% velocity zones for VELOCITY_BIASED)

structure.focus: Bridge to in-season, game-like movements (Z3/Z4 with Z8 skill emphasis)

scenario_1_elastic_emphasis.note: Youth 13-17 limit = ONE block, so elastic only this year. VELOCITY_BIASED bias maintained throughout OFF/PREP seasons per fv_bias_profile rules.

scenario_2_deceleration_emphasis.athlete_profile: Guard, previous ACL injury (cleared for full activity), COD limiter, BALANCED bias (conservative)

structure.focus: General development + movement quality refinement (balanced Z1-Z8 mix)
Braking mechanics + COD efficiency + injury prevention (Z2/Z5/Z8 emphasis)
structure.expected_gate7: GREEN (decel supports BALANCED bias, 50/50 Z2/Z5 strength with Z8 control)

structure.focus: General athletic development, maintain COD gains (balanced Z1-Z8 with Z5/Z2 emphasis)
Bridge to in-season, defensive emphasis (Z2/Z5/Z8 skill emphasis)

scenario_2_deceleration_emphasis.note: Decel block delayed to weeks 3-6 to allow general prep first, injury prevention priority for guard position.

scenario_3_no_specialization.athlete_profile: Post player, multiple limiters (strength, conditioning, movement quality), first structured off-season, BALANCED bias

structure.focus: General athletic development across all qualities (balanced Z1-Z8 distribution per fv_band_targets)

scenario_3_no_specialization.rationale: Athlete needs broad development, not specialist yet. Specialization blocks inappropriate for generalists. Build base this year, consider block next off-season.
scenario_3_no_specialization.note: Not all athletes need specialization blocks - baseline MDP is excellent programming aligned to Load Standards v2.2.0 and FV Schema v2.1

fv_zone_focus.description: Default zone emphasis when using baseline MDP programming (not in specialization block), aligned to Periodization Schema v2.1
fv_zone_focus.note: Specialization blocks override this with block-specific zone emphasis (see load_standard_profile.specialization_block_adjustments). EPA Gate 7 validates weekly zone distribution against declared fv_bias_profile per Periodization Schema v2.1 Section 2B.

baseline_programming.trigger: ICP_HS_BASKETBALL_OFFSEASON selected + no active specialization block
baseline_programming.session_generation: EPA uses MDP_COURT_VERTICAL seasonal defaults for OFF_SEASON
baseline_programming.fv_bias_input: EPA must receive fv_bias, fv_bias_assessment_date, fv_bias_rationale as part of client input contract per EPA v2.2.1 Section 1A
baseline_programming.exercise_selection: EPA filters AETHER by Band_2, Node_D, E4 ceiling, applies fv_zone_focus per fv_bias_profile
baseline_programming.gate7_validation: EPA validates weekly zone distribution against fv_band_targets for declared bias (variance ≤10% GREEN, 11-20% YELLOW, >20% QUARANTINED_REVIEW)
baseline_programming.validation: Standard EPA gates (contacts ≤120/session, tier 3 ≤40%, readiness, Gate 7 bias compliance)

pre_generation_validation: Check season (OFF_SEASON for elastic, OFF_SEASON or PREP_SEASON for decel)
NEW: Verify fv_bias_profile is legal for population/season per Governance v4.1 Gate 1 + Gate 2
NEW: Confirm fv_bias matches or complements block supported_bias_profiles (elastic supports BALANCED/VELOCITY_BIASED, decel supports BALANCED)
specialization_block_activation.generation: EPA uses block-specific weekly_structure from block JSON, not ICP defaults. EPA applies block-declared fv_zone_emphasis to exercise selection.
specialization_block_activation.gate7_behavior: EPA validates that block week generates sessions where zone distribution aligns to athlete's fv_bias within variance thresholds. If variance >20%, session QUARANTINED_REVIEW per EPA v2.2.1 Section 6 Step 5.
specialization_block_activation.monitoring: EPA enforces daily + weekly monitoring from tissue_health_monitoring
specialization_block_activation.exit_validation: EPA validates exit_assessments before returning to baseline

block_rejection_scenarios.if_already_completed_block_this_year: REJECT with reason: Youth 13-17 limit of ONE block per year reached
block_rejection_scenarios.if_wrong_season: REJECT with reason: Block not legal in current season (e.g., elastic in PREP_SEASON)
block_rejection_scenarios.if_entry_gates_fail: REJECT with reason code + specific requirement failed + legal alternative
block_rejection_scenarios.if_contraindication_present: REJECT with reason + corrective action required
block_rejection_scenarios.if_bias_illegal_for_season_or_population: REJECT per Governance v4.1 Gate 1: F-V Bias [BIAS] not allowed for [POPULATION] in [SEASON]. Athlete must use BALANCED for this season/population combination.

transition_handling.post_block_recovery: EPA generates 3-7 day recovery window (Zone 8 only, no plyos)
transition_handling.re_entry_to_baseline: EPA uses transition protocol (60% → 75% → 100% volume over 3 weeks)
transition_handling.next_block_prevention: EPA enforces minimum 8 weeks before any next specialization block (even though Youth 13-17 limit = ONE per year)

changes: Added fv_bias_profile block (default VELOCITY_BIASED, legal biases per season/population, assessment protocol, season override rules)
Added F-V bias population/season override rules aligned to Governance v4.1 Gate 1 + Gate 2
Updated population_ceilings.rationale to reference Load Standards v2.2.0 Table 3.2
Added fv_band_targets showing zone distribution targets by bias (VELOCITY_BIASED 65% velocity zones Z3/Z4/Z7/Z8, BALANCED 50/50)
Added fv_zone_emphasis and supported_bias_profiles to elastic and deceleration blocks
Added gate7_fv_bias_validation sub-section explaining EPA v2.2.1 Gate 7 algorithm, variance thresholds, and coach actions
Updated epa_integration_notes.specialization_block_activation with Gate 7 behavior, bias legality checks, and block-bias matching
Added F-V Bias Assessment to entry_assessments (CMJ + RSI + Squat 1RM)
Updated codexReference to include Load Standards v2.2.0, Periodization v2.1, Governance v4.1, Playbook v0.5.0
Aligned all load ceiling language and bias rules to v2.2.0 and Governance v4.1 standards
Added FV zone focus notes to periodization templates showing expected EPA Gate 7 status (GREEN/YELLOW)
v2_3_1.note: v2.3.1 requires EPA v2.2.1 or later for full Gate 7 compliance. Earlier EPA versions will reject F-V bias fields in input.

v2_3_0.changes: Initial specialization block integration without F-V bias awareness
